description:
Good app. It allowed me to edit date in a PDF per my needs. It presents the real markup tree of a PDF for editing. Doesn't add any watermark.
But the editing tools panel is quite bizarre. I spent quite time trying but I didn't figure out how to add a new line of text. And the "Help" feature appeared to me as just a list of titles with empty content.
Overall, since I didn't find other alternatives, this works for me.
summary: Does what is says. NO WATERMARK!

description: I could no use anything and i lost my time
Couldnt even open a simple PDF
Useless aplication

Unlike its alternative ''Master PDF editor'' it does not ask you to enter a paid key to be able to edit a pdf, and although the app looks old, it has been able to open the file and edit it without it beeing seen that it was altered (at least in my experience with KDE Plasma). I'm really impressed.

This piece of code can perhaps open pdf documents without or with simple formatting. It does not work well with heavily formatted ones. It only wants to open documents that come from the Downloads or Document folders. In other words, it's unpredictable. It's a pity that no FOSS developer has yet come out with a true PDF editor for Linux. So grand old Linux does not have a full-featured pdf editor. No wonder the market never gave its desktop a chance. You would think the best folks to do this are the LibreOffice developers.

This application purpose for still being in a Linux repository is just a scream,an invitation to the FOSS community.
It is saying, "Please revive me, please modernize me. Don't you see that I still possess some useful code built in." 

Imagine that. Until then, we'll have to depend on such problematic, buggy solutions as MasterPDF.
On the other hand, we in Linux are fortunate enough to have
other very good paid web solutions such as XODO.com.
summary: It's really unpredictable with today's formatted pdf documents

description: The app doesn't open pdf files
Can't even add a simple text
Doesn't work, interface from 1976
Rubish interface but still gived it a chance, it does not load the document properly, just couple of letters arround
Dateien lassen sich öffnen, Text ist weder sichtbar, noch bearbeitbar
The app is not up to date anymore, GUI looks very weird.
PDF opening does work but it´s not shown as intended. Removed the app immediately. Maybe suitable for really simple pdf´s like text only.
Funktioniert in keinster Weise. Findet keine Dateien in Verzeichnissen außerhalb "Dokumente" und "Downloads".

el desarrollo parece estancado, la aplicación parece de principios de los 2000, sólo se ejecuta poniendo la orden desde la terminal, no se integra con el el escritorio (xfce en mi caso) es una experiencia anticuada y poco práctica, buscaba una alternativa a master pdf, pero no está aquí
Muchas páginas se ven en blanco, y en realidad tiene un documento fotocopiado, cualquier otro programa lo ve, Deberian sacarlo del repositorio. Programas así le dan mala fama al mundo linux.
summary: Ni siquiere muestra cuando tiene una imagen incrustada

description: La interfaz que ofrece no es ni medio parecida a la que se ve en la gráfica del repositorio y lo más grave es que como editor de PDF no sirve absolutamente para nada porque, por ejemplo, no abre documentos, no permite editar los documentos generados y tampoco guardarlos. Por decencia Endless deberia eliminarlo de su repositorio.
no abre los archivos para los que está diseñada la aplicacion. mal mal mal
No funciona en Ubuntu 20.04

I was able to very easily delete some sick background images that other PDF editors couldn't event select.

Yes it's ugly for our 2023 standards, yes the UX is not great, yes I had a few crashes, but it did the job better than any other PDF editor we tested in my team, both open-source and proprietary.
summary: Ugly and unstable, but highly efficient!
